Summary: LO for 5/4 remaining patchy snow well bonded and stable Low hazard.
SnowDistribution: Sparse snow cover. Warm sunny conditions.  Winds 30-40 mph at first before decreasing.
WeatherInfluences: Another dry sunny day with moderate East-South-Easterly winds. Colder than recently although temperatures on the highest summits will remain above freezing.
SnowStability: The remaining patchy snow will remain well bonded and stable. The snow surface will become firm overnight, softening where exposed to the sun during the day. Greatest amounts remain in North and East facing gullies and coire rims above 1100 metres, very little if any snow elsewhere. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A warm sunny day. Very strong East-South-East winds initially decreased through the day.
ObservedSnowStability: The remaining patchy spring snow continues to gradually thaw and diminish. Stability is good.  The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: CM 05/04 Remaining snow patches will remain well bonded and stable. Cornice collapse! Avalanche Hazard Low.
SnowDistribution: Limited patchy snow in specific places. Winds approx 10 - 20 mph. Good visibility.
Comment: Another day without a cloud in the sky! Cool Easterly winds across the summits. Expect more of the same tomorrow.
WeatherInfluences: Fresh, cool Easterly winds. No precipitation forecast. The freezing level will be above the summits.
SnowStability: The snow patches located mainly on steep North through East to South-East aspects above 1000 meters will remain well bonded and generally stable. Some minor cornice collapse and wet snow instabilities will develop later in the day, particularly on sun affected aspects. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: Fresh East-South-East winds. Another dry, sunny and warm day with no precipitation. The freezing level was above the summits.
ObservedSnowStability: The remaining snow patches are located mainly on steep North through East to South-East aspects above 1000 meters. These areas are well bonded and generally stable. Some minor cornices and wet snow instabilities were noted on these same aspects. The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: GC 5/4. No hazard forecast. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
SnowDistribution: Sparse snow cover on the highest summits only, mostly bare ground.  Good visibility.  Winds approx 10 mph to 20 mph, cooling.
Comment: Shady snow patches remain firm with potential for consequential slips onto bare ground. Higher pressure conditions continue through the weekend.
WeatherInfluences: Continuing dry and clear, sunny through the day. Cool with fresh to strong Easterly winds, the freezing level only below the summits to around 700 metres overnight.
SnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published unless conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: Another dry and sunny day, feeling cool in the fresh South-Easterly winds. The freezing level was above the summits throughout.
ObservedSnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published unless conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

Summary: TO for 5.4: Insufficient snow for avalanche hazard.  For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
SnowDistribution: Very isolated patches of snow, mostly bare ground.  Good visibility.  Winds 20-30 mph.
WeatherInfluences: Continuing dry with clear skies overnight and sunshine through the day.  Winds will be fresh to strong East to South-Easterly.  Freezing levels will remain above the summits, a little cooler during the the middle of the morning with summit temperatures dipping to around plus 1.0 degree Celsius.
SnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published unless conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A sunny day with strong South-Easterly winds. The freezing level remained well above the summits.
ObservedSnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published unless conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

Summary: SC 5.4.25 Refrozen snow patches confined to NW, N, NE, E coires and gullies above 1000m. Sunny aspects will soften Aval Hazard Low.
SnowDistribution: Limited patchy snow in specific places, mostly bare ground. Good visibility  Winds 20-30 mph progress difficult at times with stronger gusts
Comment: High pressure remains dominant. Cold overnight temperatures expected to refreeze snow patches which will be firm and icy.
WeatherInfluences: Moderate North-North-Easterly winds overnight will strengthen and veer during the morning to become fresh Easterlies for the afternoon. No precipitation expected and the freezing level will be above the summits.
SnowStability: Little change expected. The remaining, well bonded and stable snow patches are mostly confined to North-West through North to East aspects in shady coires and gullies mostly on the higher mountains along the Northern boundary of the forecast area. The snow cover will refreeze overnight, be firm and icy. Steep, sun exposed terrain above 1000 metres will develop isolated wet snow surface instabilities during the daytime. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A dry and sunny day with fresh Easterly winds. Freezing level above the summits.
ObservedSnowStability: The remaining, well bonded and stable snow patches were initially firm, softening rapidly during the day. The main snow cover persists on North-West through North to East aspects in shady coires and gullies mostly on the higher mountains along the Northern boundary of the forecast area. Other aspects are mostly bare ground and free from snow patches. The avalanche hazard is Low.

Summary: NC for 5/4/25. There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard, See SAIS mountain blog for latest mountain conditions.
SnowDistribution: Limited patchy snow in specific places. Good visibility.  Breezy on the tops.
WeatherInfluences: Dry but turning cloudier with a cooler Easterly wind. Freezing level around the summits.
SnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published unless conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A warm and sunny day with the freezing level well above the summits.
ObservedSnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published unless conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
